meanings.definition: The state of being near in space or time.
meanings.sent1: The proximateness of the two houses made it easy for the neighbors to chat over the fence.
meanings.sent2: The proximateness of the bus stop to her house saved her a lot of time in the mornings.
meanings.sent3: The proximateness of the cookies to the cookie jar made them disappear mysteriously.
meanings.sent4: The proximateness of the finish line motivated the runners to sprint faster.
meanings.sent5: The proximateness of the thunder made the children run inside for cover.

meanings.definition: The quality of being close in relationship or connection.
meanings.sent1: The proximateness of their friendship was evident in how they finished each other's sentences.
meanings.sent2: The proximateness of their families led to frequent gatherings and celebrations.
meanings.sent3: The proximateness of their birthdays meant they always had joint parties.
meanings.sent4: The proximateness of their minds allowed them to understand each other without words.
meanings.sent5: The proximateness of their hearts made them inseparable friends.
